info.title: The Learning Machine
info.description: API specification for the `Learning Machine` as part of the _Learning Toolkit_ developed by the **Dynamic Genetics Lab** for **We The Curious**.

tags.description: APIs in use for the learning machine.

get.description: Initialise the board by returning the first group of faces (nodes) and so starting a new game session. By default, these faces will be "predicted" as `neutral`, so they can be positioned (randomly) around the centre of the board.

200.description: A list of `Nodes`, and a new `session_id`

post.description: Refresh the board with a brand new set of faces and initialise a **new** game sessoion (i.e. a new `session_id` will be returned for future requests).

requestBody.description: new_nodes (default `25`) corresponding to the number of faces to be returned by the backend.

new_nodes.description: The number of new nodes to return to the board. Default is `25`.

200.description: A new list of `Nodes`, and a new `session_id`.

post.summary: send to the backend the annotation of an image.
post.description: This endpoint enables the interaction with the backend every time a face is dragged towards an emotion (bucket). In particular, the frontend sends the label of the emotion (e.g. `happy`, `sad`) for the selected face, and the list of (`ids` for) remaining other faces currently on the board. This will have the effect of updating the ML model in the backend (i.e. learning from the **new** example), so that **new** predictions for the other current images can be returned.

requestBody.description: A new `Annotation`, and the list of current `Nodes`, along with current `session_id`. (Optional) The number of new images to include in the board (default `1`).

new_nodes.description: The number of new faces to add to the board. `new_nodes=1` by default.

items.description: The list of `uuid`s of images currently present in the board (in addition to the one that has been annotated).

200.description: New probabilities for emotions generated for remaining images, along with a new image (or images) returned.

400.description: Bad Request. `session_id` invalid or not existing

get.summary: Return statistics of Images per class in the DB
get.description: Return statistics of images in the DB (not the list). Statistics include the total number of images per each single emotion.

200.description: Numbers of images per single emotion in the DB.

get.summary: Return statustics of Images per set and per single emotion.
get.description: Aggregated statistics of images in the DB per single set (i.e. `training`, `validation` and `test`) and per single emotion.

200.description: Numbers of images per set (and per single emotion) in the DB

get.summary: Returns the single image given a valid `image_id`.
get.description: Test endpoint to retrieve image data given an `image_id`. This endpoint is so far enabled only for testing purposes (as image data will be actually enclosed into the request as `base64` string.

get.summary: returns a list (`Nodes`) of randomly selected images associated to the specified emotion. This is a test endpoint.

200.description: A list of randomly selected images from the DB for the specificed emotion.

FacesSetStats.description: Statistics summary of images per single emotiona and per group/set (i.e. `traiing`, `validation`, `test`)

FacesStats.description: Statistics summary per single emotions of the images in the Db

EmotionLinks.description: Object mapping the association between each label/emotion to its corresponding probability as predicted by the ML model in the backend. This map will be enclosed in all the instances of `Image` objects.

Image.description:
Object model encapsulating the information of an Image as returned by the backend, i.e. `ImageID`, `data`, and predicted probability for that image for each emotion.
*Note* The `data` field is used to encapsulate the actual image encoded as a `base64` string. This approach is so far preferred over using a field with a URL to issue a separate request. This will reduce the number of requests to the backend at the price of some "overhead" in the returned JSON objects. However, this field is **not required** as the backend will not include the data for images already on the board (e.g. in the response JSON object returned after an _annotation_ operation).

id.description: Unique ID of an image (as returned by the backend)

Annotation.description: Object schema used to encapsulate the info of an annotation.

BackendResponse.description: Reusable Schema for Backend Response composed by `session_id` and array of nodes.
